utterance.speaker: CONSTRUCTION WORKER
utterance.content: Hold it!

utterance.speaker: CONSTRUCTION WORKER
utterance.content: What the … Hey! Somebody call the foreman!

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: So, breakfast? Divide and conquer?

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll make the coffee.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll make the omelets.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: And I am going to make your day. I have the most exciting news. I just wanted to wait until you were finished doing – – you know, whatever you were doing in there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sleeping.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, what news?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: About your wedding.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh! Um … you’ve come up with options for flower arrangements.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I have searched high and low trying to capture the look that is the essence of you. I give you … the tunnel of love. The bride and groom walk to the altar through the arched passageway festooned with exotic flowers. Then, I found this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that … a giant photograph?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Made entirely of flowers?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yes, except it would be, of course, the two of you. Painstakingly crafted by skilled artisans. Just … But wait, there’s more.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother, as much as I appreciate your passion and obviously diligent research, I just think this is a little too much.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: In terms of expense?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In terms of – -- everything.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard, why do you just dismiss all of my ideas about your ceremony?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You mean like your ideas of bringing in giant ice sculptures of Nikki Heat or hiring the Vienna Boys Choir, or having the Blue Angels fly overhead?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard, I am simply trying to bring a little pageantry into your wedding. But it seems that the only role you want me to play is that of guest. Fine. I can do that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just asked her to check into flowers and keep it simple. With her track record I should have known better.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, she means well, Castle. She just wants to be a part of this. So let’s find something for her to do. Some kind of a wedding project.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. You’re right. But something she can’t turn into an over the top disaster.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll keep thinking.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, me too.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. So this building was set to be demolished. That is, until the salvage crew stripping this place came across this body.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Buried under concrete, no less.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You got cause of death?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Not until I do a full exam, but he’s probably been here since they poured the concrete back in 1978.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A dead man from the Carter administration entombed in cement. I am intrigued.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anything else you can tell us about the victim?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: He was maybe early 30s, and a sharp dresser. Check out that powder blue suit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, straight from the disco era.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And a testament to the truly indestructible nature of polyester.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’ll check out the building back in 1978 and who owns it now.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’ll also pull permits, see if we can track down who poured this concrete.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know who the victim is.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A man in his 30s with a penchant for pinky rings and Panerai watches who mysteriously vanished in 1978? C’mon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Vince Bianchi?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Of the Bianchi crime family?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And one of the most powerful and feared mafia dons of his day. Until he disappeared, Jimmy Hoffa style. And for over 3 decades he was right here. We just found Vince Bianchi.

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE MILT BOYLE
utterance.content: Vince Bianchi. Before he turned into the pile of bones you guys found. Back then, we were trying to take him off the streets. Then on July 30th, 1978, somebody did it for us.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: High profile case like this? Gates sure did pick the wrong week to go to a terrorism seminar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Detective Boyle? Could one of the other crime families have had him killed?

utterance.speaker: BOYLE
utterance.content: It’s definitely possible. Mickey “The Blade” Carcano, Louie “The Lip” Maneri. Both wanted to muscle in on Bianchi’s territory, so they had motive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s like being transported to a bygone era. Mickey the Blade? Louie the Lip? Where are these guys now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Probably under concrete.

utterance.speaker: BOYLE
utterance.content: Vince had rivals inside the Bianchi family.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were any of these rivals suspects?

utterance.speaker: BOYLE
utterance.content: Yeah, this guy. Frank Russo, one of his lieutenants. He took over the Bianchi family after Vince vanished and was one of the last people to see him alive. They had dinner together that night at Gino's Restaurant. The owner snapped this picture of Frank and Vince. It’s the last known photo of Vince Bianchi. Frank claimed he drove Vince home and never saw him again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do you think really happened?

utterance.speaker: BOYLE
utterance.content: I think Frank talked Vince into a night on the town, lured him someplace, and killed him. But we could never prove it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, look at the suit Vince was wearing at the restaurant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s black, it’s not powder blue.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he did go out after dinner that night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then Frank Russo is lying.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We need to talk to Frank Russo.

utterance.speaker: FRANK RUSSO
utterance.content: Vince was a good man, God rest. Now at least he’ll get a proper burial.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, Mr. Russo, we’d like to revisit the night that he disappeared.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Look, that whole thing was a ages ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right, and after it happened you took over the Bianchi crime family, isn’t that true?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: I’m legit now. I own several businesses.

utterance.speaker: MARIE RUSSO
utterance.content: Oh yeah, crumbs the family threw you when they shoved you out the door.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Hey, excuse me for making an honest living to keep four thousand square feet over your head.

utterance.speaker: MARIE
utterance.content: Yeah, but it’s not the penthouse, is it, Frank? It’s not the top floor.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: What are you going to do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? Why don’t you just walk us through what happened at Gino’s restaurant?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Vince and I broke bread. We shot the breeze. Vince talked about the future, settling down, how important it was for a don to be a family man. After dinner I dropped him home. That was it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you and Vince didn’t go out afterwards?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Again with this. How many times do I have to say it? No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then why was he found in a different suit then the one he wore at Gino’s Restaurant?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: I have no idea. If he went out after, it’s new to me. But if he did go out, Harold would have known about it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Harold?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Harold Leone. Vince didn’t brush his teeth without talking to Harold.

utterance.speaker: BOYLE
utterance.content: If you ask me, Frank’s just pointing at something shiny so you quit looking at him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, that’s very possible, but who is Harold Leone?

utterance.speaker: BOYLE
utterance.content: Vince’s advisor. His consigliere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You mean like Tom Hagen in The Godfather.

utterance.speaker: BOYLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but after Vince went missing Harold kind of dropped off the world.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was he ever a suspect?

utterance.speaker: BOYLE
utterance.content: Nah. But word was he knew things.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So where can we find him now?

utterance.speaker: BOYLE
utterance.content: I might have an address in my files.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me, ma’am? Hi. NYPD. We’re looking for Harold Leone. Is this where he lives?

utterance.speaker: YVONNE
utterance.content: Uh, I’m Yvonne. I look after Harold.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we’d like to speak with him.

utterance.speaker: YVONNE
utterance.content: Are you sure about that? I mean, he’s a sweet man deep down, but he’s just a little off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Off … how?

utterance.speaker: YVONNE
utterance.content: Pathological grieving is what they call it. Harold’s best friend disappeared back in ’78 and he never got over it, never moved on. It’s like he’s frozen in time. That’s why he stays home and still owns this car and makes me wear these dumbass clothes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, are you saying that Harold thinks it’s the 1970s?

utterance.speaker: YVONNE
utterance.content: Yeah. And anything that happens that bursts that bubble? Oh, he just gets all confused. So when you go in to talk to him, just turn off your cell phones. Pretend like it’s 40 years ago and you shouldn’t have any problem. Actually, you will have a problem.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. Look at this place.

utterance.speaker: YVONNE
utterance.content: Harold? You have guests.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD LEONE
utterance.content: Huh? Whoa. Well, this hot mama can be my guest all night long.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, sir, I’m Detective Beckett and this is Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Captain.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Oh, Captain Castle. I bet you’re showing this little lady the ropes, huh? Breaking her in, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, actually, um …

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: I mean, have you ever seen a cop with an ass that fine? If this is women’s lib, I’m all for it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To be fair, you do have a very fine … never mind.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: So, how can I help you, Captain?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, well, truth is, we’re here about Vince Bianchi.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: You found him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m afraid we did. He was found in a light blue suit. We believe he went somewhere after he left Gino’s Restaurant the night that he was killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now we were told that he kept you informed about what he did. You have any idea where he went that night?

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Yeah. And I know who killed him, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just to be clear, you’re saying you know who killed Vince Bianchi?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s his name?

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: That’s a dangerous question, sweetheart. I’m going to need protection.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can assign officers to protect you if necessary.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: If necessary. Can you tell cupcake here that I’m risking my life just talking to you guys. The people that killed Vince would do the same to me in a heartbeat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think that’s really unlikely. I mean, most of those people aren’t even around after all these years, so I –

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: What do you mean, years? Vince has not been gone … for years. No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sure what Detective Beckett meant to say –

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Is this a trick? You are trying to trick me into saying things. Maybe Vince isn’t even dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. He most definitely is.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Well then, show me. If I’m going to tell you who killed him, I’m going to see his face first.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Harold, but that’s impossible.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Why? If Vince is dead, show me his body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Harold –

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: No body, no talking.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sir, by the power vested in me by the NYPD, I will personally arrange for you to observe the deceased.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: You are a man of honor, Captain.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can we speak outside, Captain?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course. Rookies.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: “By the power vested in me?” Castle, what the hell were you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was trying to stop the meltdown he had when you stepped out of the 70s.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: By promising him a body that we don’t have?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He can help us solve an infamous gangland slaying.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe he’s delusional. We already know he’s delusional about what year it is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If we’re going to find out what he knows, he has to trust us. He has to see a body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie’s got something at the morgue.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what else she’s got? Bodies. Lots of ‘em. Maybe one of them looks enough like Vince Bianchi.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t even go there, cupcake.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This you checking out who owns that building?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m waiting on a call from records, so I figured I’d study up on the period.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: By starting with this documentary I found on these two NYPD badasses from back in the day. Snookie Watts and Ray Price. Check out Snookie’s move right here.

utterance.speaker: NARRATOR
utterance.content: Snookie, you and Ray have made quite a name for yourselves in the anti-crime units.

utterance.speaker: SNOOKIE
utterance.content: You better believe it, baby. Stopping crime one skell at a time.

utterance.speaker: RAY
utterance.content: Right on, right on. See, when the bad guys see the old red rocket here? They know a serious head cracking is on the way.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So … the good old days of police brutality.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Man. You just don’t get it.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: So it looks like our victim was killed by multiple gunshot wounds. When I pieced his skull back together I found this entry wound from a .38.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: One in the noggin. Classic mafia rub out.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Not exactly. As near as I can figure, Vince was shot in the back first. Maybe as he was walking away. There’s an exit wound in his abdomen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: In his abdomen? You got all of that from bones?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I got a little help from this. When the concrete settled on him it formed an almost perfect mold. We were able to make a cast of the body, which showed the exit wound.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We have a body. We have a body to show Harold. This is exactly what we need to get him to talk.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle! It’s rubber.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He doesn’t need to know that. Couldn’t a skilled mortician apply a little hair and makeup to this, make it look like a reasonable facsimile of Vince Bianchi?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’ve seen them do more with a lot less. But I don’t want to be a part of some crazy plan –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You have to. Because for this to work, this place has to look like the 70s. And so do you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, Mr. Maneri, now that Vince Bianchi’s death is officially a homicide, we are re-interviewing all his former enemies, including yourself. Now, is it possible for you to tell me where you were on July 30th, 1978?

utterance.speaker: DEANNA MANERI
utterance.content: I speak for my husband, Louie the Lip, here. And I tell you that he had no part in whacking Vince Bianchi. And even if he did, he doesn’t remember.

utterance.speaker: LOUIE MANERI
utterance.content: What she said.

utterance.speaker: DEANNA
utterance.content: What did the doctor tell you? What are you trying to do, make me a widow? You promised the doctor not to do that –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Would you two excuse us for a minute? Thanks.

utterance.speaker: DEANNA
utterance.content: You’re going to put yourself in an early grave!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Man, I’m spinning my wheels on this thing. Everyone connected to this case is either dead or looks like Louie the Lip over there. This guy Harold might be our only shot at solving this thing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What, the kook who thinks it’s the 70s? No way, bro. I just got us a real lead.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Connected to who owns the building?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sort of. Turns out that back in the 70s the mob had a piece of all the concrete work in the city. It was divvied up so that different crime families controlled different parts of town. Now, the concrete that Vince was found under was smack dab in the middle of Carcano territory.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And the Carcanos were Vince’s chief rivals back in the day. Are any of them still alive?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Michael Carcano. He was head of the family then and he still is today.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: MICHAEL CARCANO
utterance.content: I’m only here out of respect for Vince Bianchi. And I’ll say now what I said in ’78. It wasn’t me that did him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Really? Because we found him under your concrete.

utterance.speaker: CARCANO
utterance.content: What, I’m going to bury a body in my own back yard? Plus, if I had someone disappear they’d stay that way.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, they did. Until a developer decided to tear down that building. We know that you wanted in on Vince’s territory.

utterance.speaker: CARCANO
utterance.content: Well, here’s something you don’t know. Me and him were in talks to merge the families. Yeah. It was a beneficial deal for both sides. Losing that merger was bad for business. So why should I want to get rid of him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe because you wanted the whole pie instead of just a bigger slice.

utterance.speaker: CARCANO
utterance.content: If you boys have any more questions you can talk to my attorney. You know, after this long the truth is hard to find. If I was you I’d quit looking for it. Sometimes what’s in the past should stay there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Is that a threat?

utterance.speaker: CARCANO
utterance.content: What do you think?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I look ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ridiculously hot. Besides, what’s a little humiliation when you can find out who killed Vince Bianchi?

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: All right, so where is Vince, huh?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s in here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just hope Lanie did her part.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Whoa!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, she did her part all right.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Honey, spin around. Show me that caboose.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: You keep dreaming, mister.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is she wearing? I said 70s, not Pam Grier.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The only 70s outfit she had was her Foxy Brown Halloween costume.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Come on baby, once you go white nothing else seems right.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’d rather be dead than in end up in your bed, jive turkey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, that’s enough. Doctor Parish?

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: She’s a doctor, too? Well, that means she sure knows her way around …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Harold? We kept our end of the bargain.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Was there anything else on him? Any of his stuff?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: A pinky ring, a watch, and this. It’s one of those pressed pennies from Coney Island.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You said that you’d talk to us.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Vince always carried that coin for luck. Seeing him there, I don’t know. It just hit me that he’s really gone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Harold, we know this is hard. We need you to help us bring Vince’s killer to justice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Get down! Get down!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, thanks.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Did this really just happen? An attempted mob hit in my morgue?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, it was pure luck that no one got hurt.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: How’s Harold?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle took him home. We’ve got him under police protection.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo Beckett. I heard what hap – – wow.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Don’t you say another word.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. Looks like our shooter was a pro. He left by the stairs and he barred the door. He had an exit plan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any witnesses see him?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. But he was wearing that mask so no one got a good look at his face. But he might have been sent by Michael Carcano. Carcano just warned me and Javi off the case. Right, Javi?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m sorry, what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Check the security cameras outside the building. If we can ID the shooter maybe we can tie him to Carcano or whoever else was behind this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nice dress.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey Tory, what’ve you got?

utterance.speaker: TORY ELLIS
utterance.content: I was checking traffic cam footage near the morgue and found this. Here’s our shooter. It’s a half a block away. He must have come out the rear exit of the morgue. Now, watch. He takes off his mask.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Send this image to organized crime. Maybe they can ID him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So nobody in organized crime could tell us who he is?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, but look at him. He’s from the same generation as Vince. Maybe he was even involved in the original hit.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Either way, organized crime said that our shooter might have been brought from out of town so that he couldn’t be linked to whoever hired him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re circulating the photo and we’ve already got an APB.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s run it past FBI, too. If he’s from out of town maybe they’ll recognize him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re already on it. But what we really need is for your boy Harold to tell us what he knows.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: I was a sitting duck in there! How could you let this happen? What kind of cop are you, anyway?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Harold, we’re doing everything we can to bring in the gunman.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: This is what I get for being a snitch.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, technically you’re not a snitch because you haven’t actually told us anything yet.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Well, they don’t know that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. They don’t. They figure you’re singing like a canary.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Are you trying to make me feel better? Because this is not helping!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m trying to show you you’ve got nothing to lose and everything to gain by coming clean. Tell us who’s behind this. We can go after them and keep you safe!

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: All right. I’ll tell you everything I know.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Let’s go down to the precinct and make it official.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Precinct?

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Yeah. The precinct. I’m going to feel a little safer with all those cops around.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well … why can’t we do it here?

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Why can’t we do it there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I will tell you why not. Because the second Harold sets foot in this place it will burst his little 70s bubble.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It won’t burst his bubble – – if it looks like the 70s.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You cannot be suggesting that we redecorate the precinct.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The bare bones of this place will totally work. We just need to take away the computers and put back the typewriters.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No! No. Absolutely not.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: People tried to kill Harold because he knows who murdered Vince. This is the only way we can get him to talk to us. He’s the only lead we have.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Captain Gates will never go for it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Captain Gates isn’t here. You’re in charge.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what about all the other cops? Their clothes are a dead giveaway.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not if you, as ranking officer, order them to come to work dressed in 1970s clothing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve opened an account at a costume shop – at no small expense. They’re going to help us in our little endeavor by providing 1970s police uniforms.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This will be a minor disruption. We redress the squad room just long enough to walk Harold through. Let him dig on that 70s vibe and then he gives us a statement. It worked before, it’ll work again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The morgue was one room. You’re talking about an entire 70s makeover. That is a massive undertaking.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which is why I’ve called a specialist. Of sorts.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. My mother is going to come, help us coordinate –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re doing this for your mother?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No! Of course not. A little bit, yes. Well, we did say we’d give her a project.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, for our wedding. Not for my precinct.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let’s face it. We cannot let that woman anywhere near our wedding. But … she will love this. And then we get to solve the greatest mystery of the disco era. Besides the popularity of disco itself. It’s a win-win.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I highly doubt that. But I don’t see a better option.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You are so doing the right thing. And trust me, you will thank me. Now, take a good look around and say a fond farewell. Because by tomorrow, it’ll be the 70s.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, what is taking so long down there? Harold is ready to go and I’m running out of excuses.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is a total fiasco.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A fiasco named Martha Rodgers?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s turned this into a huge production. She’s even brought in actors.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She what? Would – – would you put her on, please?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Uh, Martha? Hey. Castle.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah. Hi, darling.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actors, Mother?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: In light of the abysmal talent pool you have here, yes, I’ve hired a couple of actors. And not only that, I have written these scripts so everybody knows exactly what their play is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We don’t need scripts! And we don’t need actors to play cops. We have actual cops!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: That is such an ignorant thing to say and an insult to the craft of acting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother, all we need is to walk Harold through the precinct and into interrogation.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard, I am trying to create an authentic experience here so that the two of you can crack this case. Now is that so wrong?

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Okay, Captain. Let’s get this show on the road.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you hear that, Mother?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Music to my ears. All right, everyone! Places, please!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Twelfth Precinct. Let’s boogie.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Come on. Let’s go already.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah. This is more like it. There’s the little lady. Hey, sweet cheeks. You look good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Stop talking, start walking. Castle, if this doesn’t work I’m going to kill you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you talking about? It has to work. Look at this place. It’s amazing. And admit it. You’re having a little bit of fun.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Hey. Most of these guys, I know. But who are those old farts?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh oh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, Harold, we should –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. Is that ‘sito and Ryan?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I can’t believe you talked me into this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just play the part, man. I am, you should, too.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Snookie Watts and Ray Price.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ah hah, that’s us, baby. What it is.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: You guys are legends. I’ve seen your pictures in the papers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Harold. Why don’t we go take that statement?

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: I want Snookie and Ray to do it. I love these guys.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Snookie, Ray, take Harold to interrogation.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: What do you mean, interrogation? I’m just going to talk these people. I’m no criminal. I can’t believe you let this chick boss you around.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He can see the entire bullpen from there. The charade was only supposed to last long enough to get him to interrogation. Harold’s going to realize that this is all fake. What do we do now?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard. Scripts are on your desks. This is outrageous, Officer. My behavior was entirely consensual.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis? What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Gram asked me to come. I’m playing a teenage runaway who hitchhiked her way to the Big Apple in search of her dreams.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wearing that?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Halter tops were big in the 70s.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So were those peasant blouses. Why – why didn’t you wear one of those?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ha … we really do have fake scripts.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. But Snookie and Ray don’t.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: I’ve gotta tell you, I dig how you guys clean up the streets.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, well, that’s super groovy Harold, but how about we talk about Vince? Who killed him?

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: First, what is the scoop on the guy you busted? That naked Puerto Rican cat? What really happened there? Huh?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The naked Puerto Rican cat? Uh … that, um … we’ve busted so many naked Puerto Rican cats, it um … they all just –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right, Harold. Here’s the lowdown, brother. Yeah, yeah. Sure, me and Snookie, we book around town in the Red Rocket busting bad guys and hunting stone cold foxes, but you are going to solve the murder of Vince Bianchi. And that is something more righteous than we have ever done. What we want is to hear your story. Can you dig it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Have a seat, Reno.

utterance.speaker: RENO
utterance.content: I’m already seated.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry, that’s –

utterance.speaker: RENO
utterance.content: I don’t talk to no fuzz, pig.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, you’re going to talk to this pig – – this fuzz.

utterance.speaker: RENO
utterance.content: Yeah? Why’s that, jive turkey?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because I’m about to make you one sweetass deal. My God, who wrote this.

utterance.speaker: RENO
utterance.content: I did.

utterance.speaker: DRUGGIE GIRL
utterance.content: I can’t do it. I can’t give up my connection, you dig?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I want the name of your pusher and I want it now!

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Okay. Here it is. Everything I know. Me and Vince, we were going to meet up later that night. When I didn’t hear from him I knew something was wrong.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And you knew who was behind it.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: But to get the whole picture we’ve got to talk about Glitterati.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s – what’s Glitterati?

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: The nightclub. You know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I know.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: What’s that sound?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh … I don’t know. What is that? What -

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, Harold, you – you were telling us about Glitterati.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s a nightclub, yes.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We know that, but what does it have to do with who killed Vince?

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What do you mean, Harold? You were just about to tell us. Come on. Lay it on me, brother.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Yeah, I just had it. Glitterati. Glitterati is the key to this whole thing. I can’t remember.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He was this close to giving up the deets on Vince’s death, but then somebody’s cell phone rings and he lost his mojo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then help him get it back.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We tried, but all he can remember is that it had something to do with a club called Glitterati.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I say me and Espo take him there. Maybe it’ll jog his memory.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That was over 30 years ago. That place probably doesn’t even exist anymore.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Actually, it’s been though a lot of different incarnations, but guess what? It’s back to being a 70s club again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This could work!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: First, the morgue. Then the precinct. And now you guys want to take him to a club? No. No. This has to stop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: After everything we’ve already done? We’re too close. We stop now, we walk away with nothing.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: Detective Beckett!

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What the hell is going on here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Take him to Glitterati. Go. Go!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Didn’t you say I’d be thanking you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe just not right away. Captain Gates! I thought you were at a terrorism seminar?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: It was canceled due to a bomb threat.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which is ironic –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, what on Earth possessed you to turn my precinct into the set of Kojak? Oh, or should I address you as Captain Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, that was so not my idea –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Oh, but the rest of this was?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, in fairness –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: And you, Detective Beckett? You know what a high profile case this is. How could you allow this circus?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, given his fixation with the 70s we thought this would be an opportunity to let Harold Leone open up about his knowledge about Vincent Bianchi’s murder.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: And did he?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well … no. But –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: So all this mess, this ridiculous display, and you have nothing to show for it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, sir, we do. APB just snagged our suspect from the morgue shooting. He stopped at a tollbooth on the Jersey Turnpike. They’re bringing him in now.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: A breakthrough achieved by proper police work, not by pretending it’s the 70s! Until I can decide what disciplinary action to take, I want the both of you out of my sight. Especially you. Now bring in Esposito and Ryan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, they’re not here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They took Harold to a – a disco.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I tell you, these clothes? That car? I feel invincible, man. Like Ray Price, kicking ass and taking names 70s style. I get it now, baby.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah? Good for you.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Whoa!

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Wow, this is out of sight!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Anything coming back to you, Harold?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, about how Glitterati connects back to Vince?

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: No, no. No, not yet. Give me a minute. Give me a minute. Hey, baby. How’re you doing, hon? That’s a nice dress. Can I talk you out of it?

utterance.speaker: ROBERT DECKER
utterance.content: You throwing a costume party out there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, here’s you in your costume after you tried to kill Harold Leone at the morgue.

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: That’s a guy walking down the street. That’s all I see.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, you seem to be walking down a lot of streets where homicides happen. Let’s see … Robert Decker. Assault convictions, manslaughter, a person of interest in six contract killings.

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: Look, you’ve got no proof. No witnesses can say I was there. Including you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We found your gun hidden in the door panel of your car. It’s going to match the bullets fired in the morgue. I’ve got you. Now, why don’t you tell me who hired you? I’ll put in a good word with the DA. Come on. Who hired you? Was it Michael Carcano?

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: I’ve got nothing to say.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you, sixty years old? So even another ten years is going to be life in prison for you.

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: Well, I’ve got more friends on the inside than the outside at this point.

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: You guys run a real tight ship here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle – – what the hell?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I got something. I was looking at old photos taken at Glitterati in the 70s. I found three of Vince on the dance floor boogying his heart out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so Vince went to the club. How is that news?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because these pictures are taken on three different occasions and he’s always wearing the same thing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The powder blue suit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a designated disco outfit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Vince must have gone to Glitterati the night that he was killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It might even be where he was killed because look who owns the club.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Excuse me one second. Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where’s Harold?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, he just took off for a second to take a leak.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Find him. Frank Russo owned the club back then and he owns it now.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
utterance.content: Hey sorry, buddy. If you want to see Mr. Russo you have to make an appointment.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Oh, no sweat.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Who the – Harold? Harold?

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Admit you killed Vince. Just admit it to me and you won’t suffer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Harold!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Drop the gun, Harold!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Drop it, now!

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Where is my stuff? The booking officer made me empty my pockets.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You have bigger problems than your personal effects, Harold. Like assault charges, like lying to the police. Tell me something. What year is it?

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: I – don’t –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Drop the act, Harold. Tell me what year it is. I know that you know.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Please stop. Please.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What year is it, Harold?

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: It is the year I need it to be, okay? When Vince was alive and things were good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Harold, what makes you think Frank Russo killed Vince?

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Vince only ever wore that blue suit to Glitterati. And when you two said that’s what he had on, I knew.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What else do you remember about what happened that night?

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Before he went to dinner, Vince told me that he needed to meet up with me later, that he had something important to tell me. And then when he didn’t show up I got worried. I – I was driving all over the place looking for him, I hit all of his old haunts, I even went to Glitterati. But there was a sign on the door that said it was closed for a private event.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when you heard Vince had that suit on?

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: I figured the private event was Frank killing him. But I knew I couldn’t go straight at Frank, not after he tried to whack me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were playing us the whole time.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: No, not at the beginning. But when I got shot at, that’s when things got real. It was like – like a bubble popped inside me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You asked us to bring you to the precinct hoping you could see what Frank looks like now. Hoping we would lead you right to his doorstep.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Frank needed to pay for what he did to Vince.

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: I didn’t try to whack anybody. Not Vince, not Harold either.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Then who did, Frank?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: How the hell would I know? But if Harold is saying I took out Vince he is way off base.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, Vince went to Glitterati that night, yet you had it closed for an event.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s your club, Frank. Are you trying to tell us that you don’t know what’s going on inside your own club?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What happened that night?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: What I’m about to tell you I never told anybody. It was Vince. Vince booked the club that night.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Vince had the private event?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: He brought it up over dinner, said he wanted the club to himself that night. I mean, he was the boss. What was I going to do, say no? Vince goes to my club, ends up missing? If people knew that they would have thought I killed him. So I kept my mouth shut about it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why would Vince want the club?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: He had been talking about settling down, getting married. I figured he was proposing to some girl. Plus, when I opened up the next morning "Last Dance" was on the turntable. A romantic favorite back then.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So what girl?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: He didn’t talk about her and I didn’t ask. But I knew he had someone special in his life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And who’s this mystery woman? Did she lure Vince to the club to be assassinated or did some romantic plan of his go horribly awry?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That may be exactly what happened. I went through Harold’s personal effects. Look at what I found.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was this the item you were so worried about, Harold?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s from Coney Island, just like Vince’s. Even has the same date stamped on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You carried it with you, just like Vince did. Seeing it at the morgue, it brought you to tears.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You and Vince were in love.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Yes. We were. We tried not to be, but …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you were going to lose him.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Wait. You can’t be thinking that I killed Vince.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, we believe that he went to Glitterati to propose marriage. He was leaving you for a woman.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Of course he was. I was the one who told him he had to get married. It would ruin him if people found out about us. Being his number two was enough for me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Harold, if Vince was getting married how come no one else knew about it?

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: It had to be kept hush hush. You see, this was more than a marriage. It was a merger. Vince was going to marry Michael Carcano’s sister and unite the two families. But he never told me that he was going to propose that night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who is Michael Carcano’s sister? What’s her name?

utterance.speaker: MARIE
utterance.content: Frank’s not here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, actually we’re not looking for Frank, Mrs. Russo. Would you mind if we came in?

utterance.speaker: MARIE
utterance.content: Let’s keep this short. My meditation teacher’s on her way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so then why don’t you tell us what happened at Glitterati the night that Vince vanished?

utterance.speaker: MARIE
utterance.content: How would I know?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because you were there.

utterance.speaker: MARIE
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Vince had "Last Dance" playing. You thought he was going to propose. To cement, as it were, the union between your two families.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But he couldn’t go through with it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You couldn’t handle the rejection. So as he left you shot him in the back, then again in the face. You know, because it was personal.

utterance.speaker: MARIE
utterance.content: You guys have quite the imagination.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your brother knew that Vince’s murder would trigger a mob war. So he used his access to concrete to make Vince disappear.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: After that you hitched your wagon to Frank. But his tenure as head of the Bianchi family was disappointingly brief.

utterance.speaker: MARIE
utterance.content: You can’t prove any of this. All you’ve got is a story. Now get out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If it is just a story, then you wouldn’t have hired a hit man. Robert Decker decided that he didn’t want to die in prison so he rolled on you. He told us that you paid him to kill Harold when you found out he was talking to the cops.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And here’s the funny part. Well, maybe not so funny to you. Nobody, including Harold, knew you killed Vince. If you had just left Harold alone it would’ve stayed that way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Marie Russo, you are under arrest for conspiracy to commit murder. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: I wish Vince had just said yes to her. Maybe then he’d still be alive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, he had to follow his heart. It’s probably what he wanted to tell you that night.

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Isn’t that something? Knowing he did that for me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, how does it feel to be in the 2010s?

utterance.speaker: HAROLD
utterance.content: Ah, it’s okay. I’m ready to say goodbye to the 70s. Say goodbye to Vince.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then, let’s do it the right way. Honor the times along with the man.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, tell me you don’t mean –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, but I do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I had no idea you could disco dance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, Castle. I’m a woman of many hidden talents.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I look forward to discovering every single one.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey, Dad!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, sweetie! I’m digging those groovy duds.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Doesn’t she look stunning in this outfit?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m just glad it covers more this time.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh, Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother, thank you so much for everything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was spectacular.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Now that you guys have connected to my vision here, perhaps we can revisit the flowers?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Dig it, man. The 70s is a cool place to visit, but I would not want to live here, bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You sure about that, blood?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, Lord have mercy. Oh, Snookie, Snookie now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Captain Gates. Does this mean all is forgiven?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: It means I like to dance, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Perfect.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cheers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, Castle, look. Look at Harold.
